context.content: "Psycho (1960)" is a classic psychological thriller directed by Alfred Hitchcock. It delves into the complex emotions and motivations of its characters, particularly the mysterious and enigmatic Norman Bates. The film also presents a gripping mystery surrounding the disappearance of Marion Crane and the unsettling secrets of the Bates Motel. It's a thought-provoking and emotionally intense film that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

Wow, "Psycho (1960)" sounds really intriguing! I love the idea of delving into the complex emotions and motivations of the characters, and the gripping mystery surrounding the disappearance. I think I'll definitely give it a watch. Thank you for the recommendation! [END]
